results.assistant_text: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second (about 300,000 kilometers per second or 186,282 miles per second). This is a fundamental physical constant, often denoted by the letter "c."
The Treaty of Versailles was signed on June 28, 1919.
Mount Kilimanjaro stands at 5,895 meters (19,341 feet) above sea level, making it the highest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain in the world.

The flux capacitor is a fictional device from the "Back to the Future" film series, invented by the character Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown, portrayed by Christopher Lloyd. In the movie's storyline, Doc Brown conceived the idea on November 5, 1955, after slipping and hitting his head while hanging a clock in his bathroom.
